this one's fun!

but of much less practical importance than the constructor one (like `Int(::String) = 99` )

tbh it seems a "very Julia" thing to me that you're able to do evil things if you're willing to put in a little effort... so i'm almost okay with this one

but i'd really got used to the "no accidental piracy when using `using` " thing

text:
I think one concern would be macros that generate code like
```quote 
    (::typeof($(esc(x))))(y) = ...
end```
where `x` is some user input. They might end up comitting piracy without knowing it.

text:
> I think I might actually have code that depends on this behavour.
I think anyone who has added `:call` methods to structs they don't own depends on this behaviour. I'm not sure I've ever seen someone qualify in this sort of code.

text:
Yeah, I do, depend on this.
That i am allowed to overload `(op::typeof(f))(args...)=...`  , to avoid worrying about qualifying `Foo.f(args…)`
<https://github.com/invenia/Nabla.jl/pull/189/files#diff-b1a24bd920d3892647623cf3950d630d1684c9137487fd96cbfc7b4cb352efddR148>
